DOC.brief_title: T-IR- Study Understand Effects Testosterone Estrogen Body 's Response Hormone Insulin
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator examine effect testosterone insulin sensitivity body composition men . This study may lend great insight increase risk diabetes evident men low circulating level testosterone . Three drug use study : acyline , give injection ; testosterone ( T ) gel apply skin ; letrozole , oral drug block conversion androgen ( male hormone ) estrogen ( female hormone ) . Acyline inhibits production luteinizing hormone ( LH ) follicle stimulate hormone ( FSH ) . When acyline stop production hormone , block signal brain stimulates testicle make testosterone . Adding testosterone acyline restore physiologic level testosterone study participant . One group men receive T gel letrozole , aromatase inhibitor ; men normal level testosterone low level estrogen blood . This design enable determination respective metabolic effect testosterone estrogen .
DOC.criteria: PSA ≤ 3 ng/mL Age 2555 year Ability understand study , study procedure provide inform consent Serum total T > 300 ng/dL Normal reproductive history exam International Prostate Symptom Score ( IPSS ) < 11 A history prostate cancer include suspicious DRE history highgrade PIN prostate biopsy Invasive therapy BPH past History acute urinary retention previous 3 month Current recent past use androgenic antiandrogenic drug , steroid drug interfere steroid metabolism ( within last 3 month ) Current use statin glucocorticoid Severe systemic illness ( renal , liver , cardiac , lung disease , cancer , diabetes mellitus ) skin disease A history current breast cancer Known , untreated obstructive sleep apnea Hematocrit > 50 < 34 Hypersensitivity drug use study History bleed disorder anticoagulation Participation drug study within past 90 day History drug alcohol abuse within last 12 month Weight > 280 lb . BMI ≥ 33 Desire fertility next 6 month current pregnant partner Sperm concentration < 14 million/ml Significant , uncontrolled hypertension ( BP > 160/100 mmHg ) ; subject wellcontrolled BP medical therapy eligible participate
